info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 18 at 4:00PM EDT until March 18 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Caribou ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Pleasant River flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis.
* WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Pleasant River flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding near Pleasant Street and Pleasant River Road in Milo. - Pleasant Street and Pleasant River Road are closed due to flooding. Minor flooding expected downstream to the Piscataquis River. Water is expected to rise behind the jam upstream along the Pleasant River Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milo. - Ice jam located at the Pleasant Street bridge in Milo. Minor flooding is occurring on Pleasant Street, Pleasant River Road and in the fields of Medford Road in Milo. - For flood safety visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING
